meanings.definition: To change food into energy for the body.
meanings.sent1: Our bodies metabolise food to give us energy.
meanings.sent2: Cells metabolise nutrients to produce energy.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if I can metabolise pizza into superpowers.
meanings.sent4: Her determination metabolised her fear into courage.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays metabolise the plants, making them grow.

meanings.definition: To break down substances in the body for energy.
meanings.sent1: The stomach helps metabolise food for our bodies.
meanings.sent2: Enzymes in the body metabolise proteins for energy.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could metabolise chores as quickly as I metabolise snacks.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to metabolise her doubts, giving her strength.
meanings.sent5: The engine of the car metabolises fuel to keep it running.

meanings.sent1: After eating, the body starts to metabolise the food.
meanings.sent2: Animals metabolise nutrients to stay alive.
meanings.sent3: I feel like my brain needs to metabolise all the information it's receiving.
meanings.sent4: The city seemed to metabolise the energy of its inhabitants.
meanings.sent5: The earth metabolises the elements to sustain life.
